text: Asahi linux seems really neat but i cant get over the immense waste of manpower that would be solved if apple just open sourced their drivers/docs.

text: What would be the advantage of Asahi over Ubuntu for example?

text: Looks like I should have Googled Asahi Linux first. Didn't realize it's going to run native on Apple M1 rather under virtualization.

text: "immense waste of manpower" describes every effort to circumvent apples bullshit

text: I look forward when we can support Apple GPUs under Asahi Linux, but not Mac Os...

text: Ah.. Asahi means ‘morning sun’. For me it’s a beer label, not a very good one, but not bad.
